header.title: Rising Anti-Semitism in Sweden?
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: Articles: https://www.i24news.tv/en. Live: https://video.i24news.tv/page/live?cl.... Replay: https://video.i24news.tv/page/5a97b81.... . Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/i24newsEN/. Twitter: https://twitter.com/i24NEWS_EN. Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/i24news/. . THE RUNDOWN | After a series of incidents targeting Jews in Malmo and elsewhere, is Sweden starting to face an anti-Semitism crisis? Former Israel-Sweden Friendship Committee Vice Chair Ilya Meyer discusses with hosts Calev Ben-David and Nurit Ben.. . Story:. . A Jewish Sweden woman in her 60s is in critical condition after she was stabbed repeatedly in the central city of Helsinborg on Tuesday, in an attack that is feared to have been motivated by anti-Semitism. . . The woman, said to be an active member of the Jewish community in the city, was reportedly stabbed nine times around 7:30 AM local time when she was thought to have been on her way to work. . . Authorities have yet to official state the nature of the attack, but the local Jewish community and Israel's Foreign Ministry has stated that it appears to be fueled by anti-Semitism. The official background of the incident is still under investigation and a manhunt for the assailant is underway.. . Police have increased security around Jewish centers in the city as a precaution, local media reported. . . According to Israel's Foreign Ministry, the assailant was a Muslim man known to authorities, reported the Times of Israel. No official confirmation was given from Sweden.. . Israel's President Reuven Rivlin issued a statement shortly after the news:. . 'Once again, Jews in Europe are in danger. Today's brutal stabbing of a woman in Helsingborg, Sweden reminds us that we cannot rely on fading memories of the Holocaust to keep today's Jewish communities safe. Our thoughts and prayers are with the injured, her family and community.'. . 'We will fight anti-Semitism with all our might, and will speak out against these dreadful incidents. Our thoughts and prayers are with the injured, her family and community,' he added.. . Anti-Semitic attacks have been on the rise across Europe and the United States in recent years. . . Anti-Semitic offenses rose almost 10 percent in Germany last year, and violent attacks were up more than 60 percent. In France, anti-Semitic incidents increased by 74 percent, from 311 in 2017 to 541 last year.
